nodes.body: @dignissimus You might also be interested in #13233

### PR summary [57df694208](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13442/commits/57df694208111a26789ab793f7187e968b4b16bb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Tactic`|1|
| `Mathlib.Tactic.MAbel` (new file)|580|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ id'`
`+ ofMul'_eq_ofMul`
`+ ofMul_div'`
`+ ofMul_eq_zero'`
`+ ofMul_inv'`
`+ ofMul_mul'`
`+ ofMul_one'`
`+ ofMul_pow'`
`+ ofMul_zpow'`
`+ toAdditiveLocalDecl`
`+ toAdditiveTarget`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@joneugster 
> Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!
> 
> (As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)
> 
> However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.

Thank you for the review! I'm so sorry for the time it's taken me to get back to this. I've rewritten the tactics to avoid delaborating the expressions and I've also added tests for the to_additive tactic. All the tests pass except a few concerning error messages for examples that are expected to fail but I'm unsure about how to approach these: they are expected to be of the form "mabel_nf made no progress" but the tactic returns "unresolved goals: ..."

I'm also available on GitHub and Zulip to discuss further reviews and I can to rewrite the tactic if I should take a different approach

Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!

(As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)

However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.

Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!

(As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)

However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.
As far as I understand, your `to_additive` always requires an equality, doesn't it?

Yes, you're right: do you think this looks better? https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/978e07f8fd2d0b8d57fd6065f6e775716181f0f7

```diff
diff --git a/Mathlib/Tactic/MAbel.lean b/Mathlib/Tactic/MAbel.lean
index 0009680e97072..82875cb738c0e 100644
--- a/Mathlib/Tactic/MAbel.lean
+++ b/Mathlib/Tactic/MAbel.lean
 @[inherit_doc mabel1] macro (name := mabel1!) "mabel1!" : tactic => `(tactic| mabel1 !)
 
 /--
 Tactic for evaluating expressions in multiplicative abelian groups.
+Fails if the target is not an equality.
 
 * `mabel!` will use a more aggressive reducibility setting to determine equality of atoms.
-* `mabel1` fails if the target is not an equality.
 
 For example:
 ```
I would like to see some `to_additive` specific tests, too.

I added a few in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13442/commits/30777f1d7c8f6f79f32062f43c674eb1501aece0. I modelled them after the existing mabel tests but replaced the mabel tactic with a combination of `to_additive` and `mabel`

I think this needs improvement. For one thing, going via `delab` seems wrong to me!

Regarding `to_additive at h`, I think the skeleton would look like this:

```lean
syntax (name := to_additive) "to_additive" (location)? : tactic

elab_rules : tactic | `(tactic| to_additive $[$loc]?) => withMainContext do
  let loc := (loc.map expandLocation).getD (.targets #[] true)
  withLocation loc
    (atLocal := fun h ↦ do
      pure ()
    )
    (atTarget := do
      pure ()
    )
    (failed := fun _ ↦ throwError "to_additive made no progress")

```

Thank you for this PR! It would be desirable to have `mabel` and implementing it via a `to_additive` tactic seems reasonable to me!

(As mentioned in PR #13233, we currently thought your approach was preferable as it's simpler to maintain; given that there aren't massive short-comings that haven't been identified yet)

However, `to_additive` itself will need improvement, as mentioned below, delaborating the expressions back into terms is probably the wrong approach! Maybe you could ask for help in the ["metaprogramming/tactics" stream on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics) if you want to.

Thank you for the review! I'm so sorry for the time it's taken me to get back to this. I've rewritten the tactics to avoid delaborating the expressions and I've also added tests for the to_additive tactic. All the tests pass except a few concerning error messages for examples that are expected to fail but I'm unsure about how to approach these: they are expected to be of the form "mabel_nf made no progress" but the tactic returns "unresolved goals: ..."

I'm also available on GitHub and Zulip to discuss further reviews and I can to rewrite the tactic if I should take a different approach
